meanings.definition: To enclose or envelop in or as if in a bosom.
meanings.sent1: She embosomed the kitten in a warm blanket.
meanings.sent2: The flowers were embosomed by the lush greenery of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel embosomed the acorn in its cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: The fog embosomed the city, hiding it from view.
meanings.sent5: The mother embosomed her child in a tight hug, full of love.

meanings.sent1: The castle was embosomed by tall mountains.
meanings.sent2: The small island was embosomed by the vast ocean.
meanings.sent3: The cake was embosomed by a ring of candles.
meanings.sent4: The music embosomed the audience in a wave of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fireplace embosomed the room, creating a cozy atmosphere.
